docs.title: Epic Games Free Games Auto-Claimer
docs.text: Automated Epic Games Store free-game claimer running in Docker.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This container periodically checks for new free games and redeems them automatically under your Epic account.

Image: ghcr.io/claabs/epicgames-freegames-node:latest

docs.title: Container Configuration
docs.text: Container name: epicgames-freegames Host Port: 5081 → 3000 Config Path: /volume1/docker/epicgames-freegames/config/config.json Schedule: Runs every 6 hours (0 0,6,12,18 * * *) Time Zone: America/Denver

docs.title: Docker Compose
docs.text:
services:
  epicgames:
    image: ghcr.io/claabs/epicgames-freegames-node:latest
    container_name: epicgames-freegames
    volumes:
      - /path/to/config:/usr/app/config
    ports:
      - 5081:3000
    environment:
      - TZ=America/Denver
    restart: unless-stopped

docs.title: Configuration (config.json)
docs.text:
{
  "runOnStartup": true,
  "cronSchedule": "0 0,6,12,18 * * *",
  "logLevel": "info",
  "testNotifiers": false,
  "webPortalConfig": {
    "baseUrl": "http://YOUR_IP:5081"
  },
  "accounts": [
    { "email": "your@email.com" }
  ],
  "notifiers": [
    {
      "type": "email",
      "smtpHost": "smtp.gmail.com",
      "smtpPort": 587,
      "secure": false,
      "emailSenderAddress": "[REDACTED]",
      "emailSenderName": "Epic Games Captchas",
      "emailRecipientAddress": "[REDACTED]",
      "auth": {
        "user": "[REDACTED]",
        "pass": "[REDACTED]"
      }
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Device Authorization
docs.text:
When the container requires authentication, it prints a link: 

http://YOUR_IP:5081/abcdef

Open that link immediately and complete Epic's device login.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
JSON syntax error with Windows line endings: 

dos2unix /path/to/config/config.json

Discord webhook errors: Verify webhook URL and permissions.

docs.title: Update Procedure
docs.text:
docker pull ghcr.io/claabs/epicgames-freegames-node:latest
docker stop epicgames-freegames
docker rm epicgames-freegames
docker compose up -d epicgames-freegames

docs.title: Syncthing
docs.text: Continuous file synchronization across devices.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Syncthing is a decentralized, peer-to-peer file sync solution that keeps files synchronized across multiple devices without requiring a central server.

docs.title: Docker Compose Configuration
docs.text:
services:
  syncthing:
    image: syncthing/syncthing:latest
    container_name: syncthing
    hostname: homelab-sync
    environment:
      - PUID=1000
      - PGID=1000
      - TZ=America/Denver
    volumes:
      - /path/to/config:/var/syncthing
      - /path/to/data:/data
    ports:
      - 8384:8384   # Web UI
      - 22000:22000/tcp  # Sync protocol
      - 22000:22000/udp
      - 21027:21027/udp  # Local discovery
    restart: unless-stopped

docs.title: Access
docs.text:
• Web UI: http://localhost:8384
  • Default sync folder: /data

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Open the web UI
  2. Add remote devices by exchanging device IDs
  3. Configure folders to share
  4. Set ignore patterns as needed

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Cloud services provide file storage, synchronization, and collaboration capabilities similar to Google Drive or Dropbox, but self-hosted with complete data control.

docs.title: Nextcloud
docs.text: File sync and collaboration platform with All-in-One deployment.

docs.title: Docker Compose Configuration
docs.text:
services:
  nextcloud:
    image: nextcloud/all-in-one:latest
    restart: always
    container_name: nextcloud-aio-mastercontainer
    volumes:
      - nextcloud_aio_mastercontainer:/mnt/docker-aio-config
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro
    ports:
      - 80:80
      - 8080:8080
    environment:
      - APACHE_PORT=11000
      - APACHE_IP_BINDING=0.0.0.0
      - SKIP_DOMAIN_VALIDATION=true
      - NEXTCLOUD_DATADIR=/mnt/ncdata

volumes:
  nextcloud_aio_mastercontainer:
    name: nextcloud_aio_mastercontainer

docs.title: Nabu Casa ZWA-2 (Zigbee + Z-Wave)
docs.text:
Device Path: /dev/ttyACM0

Device ID: /dev/serial/by-id/usb-Nabu_Casa_ZWA-2_80B54EE5C54C-if00

Attributes: 

Subsystem: tty
Device path: /dev/ttyACM0
ID: /dev/serial/by-id/usb-Nabu_Casa_ZWA-2_80B54EE5C54C-if00
ID_MODEL: ZWA-2
ID_SERIAL: Nabu_Casa_ZWA-2_80B54EE5C54C
ID_USB_DRIVER: cdc_acm
ID_VENDOR: Nabu_Casa

docs.title: Docker Compose Configuration
docs.text:
services:
  homeassistant:
    image: ghcr.io/home-assistant/home-assistant:stable
    container_name: homeassistant
    privileged: true
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - TZ=America/Denver
    volumes:
      - /path/to/config:/config
    devices:
      - /dev/ttyACM0:/dev/ttyACM0
    network_mode: host

Note: Pass through the Z-Wave USB device using the stable /dev/serial/by-id/ path to avoid issues if device enumeration changes.

docs.title: Intel QuickSync Configuration
docs.text:
For hardware-accelerated transcoding on Intel Alder Lake integrated graphics:

  1. Pass through /dev/dri to the container
  2. Ensure the container user has access to the render and video groups
  3. Enable Intel QuickSync in Jellyfin admin dashboard

docs.title: Docker Compose Example
docs.text:
services:
  jellyfin:
    image: jellyfin/jellyfin:latest
    container_name: jellyfin
    user: 1000:1000
    network_mode: host
    volumes:
      - /path/to/config:/config
      - /path/to/cache:/cache
      - /path/to/media:/media
    devices:
      - /dev/dri/renderD128:/dev/dri/renderD128
      - /dev/dri/card0:/dev/dri/card0
    restart: unless-stopped

docs.title: What is a Homelab?
docs.text: A homelab is a personal environment where you can experiment with technology, servers, networking, and various IT services in a safe, controlled setting. It's essentially your own data center at home.

docs.title: Learning and Experimentation
docs.text:
• Test new software and configurations
  • Practice system administration skills
  • Learn about networking and security
  • Experiment with containers and virtualization

docs.title: Self-Hosting Services
docs.text:
• Media Server: Plex, Jellyfin, or Emby
  • File Storage: Nextcloud or Synology
  • Home Automation: Home Assistant
  • Network Services: DNS, VPN, reverse proxy

docs.title: Development Environment
docs.text:
• Test applications before production
  • CI/CD pipelines
  • Database testing
  • Development sandboxes

docs.title: Basic Components
docs.text:
1. Hardware: Old PCs, Raspberry Pis, or dedicated servers
  2. Virtualization: Proxmox, VMware ESXi, or VirtualBox
  3. Networking: Switches, routers, VLANs
  4. Storage: NAS, external drives, RAID arrays

docs.title: Benefits
docs.text:
• Hands-on learning experience
  • Privacy and data control
  • Cost savings on cloud services
  • Career skill development

docs.title: Fail2ban
docs.text: Intrusion prevention system that protects services from brute-force attacks.

docs.title: Docker Compose Configuration
docs.text:
services:
  fail2ban:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/fail2ban:latest
    container_name: fail2ban
    cap_add:
      - NET_ADMIN
      - NET_RAW
    network_mode: host
    environment:
      - PUID=1000
      - PGID=1000
      - TZ=Etc/UTC
      - VERBOSITY=-vv
    volumes:
      - /path/to/fail2ban/config:/config
      - /var/log:/var/log:ro
      - /var/www/logs/access.log:/remotelogs/nextcloud:ro
    restart: unless-stopped

docs.title: Log Path
docs.text:
Map the Nextcloud log directory as a read-only volume: 

- /var/www/logs/access.log:/remotelogs/nextcloud:ro

docs.title: Jail Configuration
docs.text:
Create /config/fail2ban/jail.d/nextcloud.local:

[nextcloud]
enabled = true
port = http,https
protocol = tcp
filter = nextcloud
logpath = /remotelogs/nextcloud
maxretry = 5
bantime = 3600
findtime = 600

docs.title: Filter
docs.text:
Create /config/fail2ban/filter.d/nextcloud.conf:

[Definition]
failregex = ^{"reqId":".*","remoteAddr":"<HOST>","app":"core".*"message":"Login failed:
            ^{"reqId":".*","remoteAddr":"<HOST>","app":"core".*"message":"Token login failed
ignoreregex =

docs.title: Monitoring
docs.text:
View banned IPs: 

docker exec -it fail2ban fail2ban-client status
docker exec -it fail2ban fail2ban-client status nextcloud

Unban an IP: 

docker exec -it fail2ban fail2ban-client set nextcloud unbanip <IP>
